result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dreshawn Damar Freeman

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Dreshawn Damar Freeman.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Dreshawn Damar Freeman.  Assistant District Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court finds the State has complied with victim notification.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court amended bail to $20,000.  The non monetary conditions are to remain as previously set.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn

Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Dreshawn Damar Freeman.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Dreshawn Damar Freeman.  Assistant District  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Parties request dates for bail motion, final pretrial and jury trial.   Court advised parties that any evidentiary motions are to be filed by 11/28/22, any reply/responses due 12/23/22.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 16, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for April 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Bail Motion, Filed.

Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Dreshawn Damar Freeman.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Dreshawn Damar Freeman.  Prosecuting attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant's appearance waived.  Defense is requesting a short adjournment for scheduling.  State does not object.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman in court.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Thomas Reed from the Public Defender's Office appeared to apprise the court of  their ability to appoint counsel.  For reasons as stated on the record, at this time the Office of Public Defender has not been able to appoint counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned in Br 45.  mn
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman not in court, defendant in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing.  Public Defender's office has not reappointed new counsel.  The Court sets this matter for further Status and orders Attorney Thomas Reed from the PD's office to appear at next hearing to explain issue with reappointment of counsel.  Defendant shall appear via zoom for next date.  Case adjourned to Br. 45.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman not in court, defendant in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not been appointed counsel.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Br 45.  mn  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman in court with attorneys Ashley Fard and Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dreshawn Damar Freeman appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for a Jury status hearing. At the defendant's requests, defense motion to withdraw. Defendant wish to retain private counsel. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court and was advise to place defendant back on the SPD appointment list to appoint new counsel.  Court vacates the scheduled jury trial and adjourns matter for a status of counsel.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman in court with attorney Ashley Fard and Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dreshawn Damar Freeman appeared by video means.  
Case in court for scheduling conference. Discovery has been turned over to defense except the autopsy and toxicology report. Case is in trial posture. Motion filing deadline is 05/20/2022. Case remains calendared in B. 34.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman in court with Attorney Ashley Fard; both appear by video.  Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman in custody.  Paul Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD has been appointed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report  received and filed
Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed

Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant is not eligible for SPD appointment and has not retained private.  Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing. Next court date provided by the clerk in Br. 34.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.   
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Dreshawn Damar Freeman in custody.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dreshawn Damar Freeman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
